trans-unit.source: Provides a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost"></xref> for registering a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.SecurityTokenService"></xref> The service host will have multiple endpoints registered based on the number of listeners registered in the configuration.
By default, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustServiceHost> class provides the following:
It adds WS-Trust endpoints to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost> based on the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration.TrustEndpoints%2A> property.
It enables metadata over the base addresses if the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration.DisableWsdl%2A> property is set to `false`.
It configures the service certificate on the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost> service credentials if a WIF configuration section specifies a service certificate.
Note that this will override the equivalent service certificate settings in WCF configuration.
It integrates IdentityModel token handlers into the security processing pipeline by calling the ExtensibleSecurityCredentials.ConfigureServiceHost method on itself.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustServiceHost> class may be overridden to customize this behavior.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustServiceHost"></xref> class with the specified base addresses and service (STS) configuration settings.
A default <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustServiceContract> is created using the specified <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration> instance.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration> instance is used for one-time initialization of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost>; for this reason, setting properties on the configuration instance after the host is initialized may not result in behavior changes.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration"></xref> that contains the STS settings to use to initialize the service host.
An array of <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> that contains the base addresses for the service host.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustServiceHost"></xref> class with the specified base addresses and service contract.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustServiceContract"></xref> that represents the service contract to use.
An array of <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> that contains the base addresses for the service host.
baseAddresses is `null`.
-or-
serviceContract is `null`.
Loads the service description information from the configuration file and applies it to the runtime that is being constructed.
Configures metadata (WSDL) for the service host.

This method evaluates the base addresses of the service host, and adds mex endpoints for http, https, net.tcp, and net.pipe addresses, only when no mex endpoints have been previously added by the user.
For http and https addresses, HTTP and HTTPS, the GET mechanism for WSDL retrieval is enabled.
Override of the base class method.
Configures the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ServiceConfiguration"></xref> on the service host and then invokes the base implementation.
Invokes the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustServiceHost.UpdateServiceConfiguration%2A> method and then invokes the base implementation.
Gets the security token service (STS) configuration for this this instance.
The STS configuration.
Gets the service contract associated with this instance.
The service contract for this instance.

Overrides the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceCredentials.IdentityConfiguration"></xref> on the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase.Credentials"></xref> property of the service host with the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustServiceHost.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration"></xref> property.
